revised_title: Discovery of Hexosephosphate in Yeast Juice
tldr: The authors discovered a new compound, hexosephosphate, formed by yeast juice and phosphate. They found that the rate of fermentation of glucose by yeast juice is greatly increased by the addition of a soluble phosphate. The compound undergoes some alteration during fermentation, and a combination of the phosphate with the sugar, forming a phosphoric acid ester, is suggested to have taken place. The study provides insights into the metabolism of sugars and phosphates in yeast.
